description: For vlans/ports on which one or more of the IP Security
features have been enabled, this trap will be generated when a packet
received on that vlan/port is in violation of the configured IP
Security protections

event.Summary: Packet received from $v4 violated IP security protections

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityViolation EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityVlanIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityVlanDescr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityPortIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityIpAddr a 192.0.2.1 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityMacAddress s EXAMPL EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityViolationType i 1

description: The ifIndex of the VLAN on which the violating packet was received.
variables.name: EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityVlanIfIndex

description: The description(name) of the VLAN on which the violating packet was received.
variables.name: EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityVlanDescr

description: The ifIndex of the port on which the violating packet was received.
variables.name: EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityPortIfIndex

description: Source IP address of the violating packet
variables.name: EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityIpAddr

description: Source MAC address in the violating packet
variables.name: EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityMacAddress

description: The type of IP Security violation that occurred
- rogueDhcpServerPacket(1)
A rogue DHCP server packet was received.
- badIpMacBindingInArpPacket(2)
The IP-MAC binding received in the ARP packet does not exist in
the DHCP Bindings table.
- badIpInArpPacket(3)
The Source IP address in the ARP payload is invalid.
- badMacInArpPacket(4)
One of the MAC addresses in the ARP payload does not match with
its counterpart in the ethernet header.
variables.name: EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityViolationType

description: For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection IP
features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when a packet
received on that port if the packet's source IP == destination IP

event.Summary: Source IP $v8 and destination IP $v10 are same for the received packet

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityAnomalyIpViolation EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyPortIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyVlanIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyVlanDescr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcMacAddress s EXAMPL EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestMacAddress s EXAMPL EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyVlanTag i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcIpAddrType i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcIpAddr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestIpAddrType i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestIpAddr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyIpProto i 0

description: For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection L4port
features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when a packet
received on that port if
1) the packet is a TCP or UDP packetr. AND
2) its source L4 port == destination port

event.Summary: Source L4 port $v12 and destination L4 port $v13 are same for TCP or UDP packet

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityAnomalyL4PortViolation EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyPortIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyVlanIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyVlanDescr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcMacAddress s EXAMPL EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestMacAddress s EXAMPL EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyVlanTag i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcIpAddrType i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcIpAddr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestIpAddrType i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestIpAddr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyIpProto i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcL4Port u 9999 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestL4Port u 9999

description: For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection TCP flags
features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when a TCP
packet received on that port if
1) (TCP flag SYN is set) and (its TCP source port < 1024). OR
2) (TCP flag == 0) and (TCP seq # == 0). OR
3) (TCP flag FIN/URG/PSH bits sre set) and (TCP seq # == 0). OR
4) Both TCP iflag SYN and FIN are set

event.Summary: Violating packet received on the VLAN $v3

description: For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection TCP fragment
features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when a packet
received on that port if
1) the packet is a TCP, and its size of the TCP header is less than pre-configured value; or
2) the packet is a TCP and it is a IP fragmented packet (IP offset != 0)
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::extremeIpSecurityAnomalyTcpFragmentViolation EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyPortIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyVlanIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyVlanDescr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcMacAddress s EXAMPL EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestMacAddress s EXAMPL EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyVlanTag i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcIpAddrType i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalySrcIpAddr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestIpAddrType i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyDestIpAddr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyTcpFragmentReason i 0 EXTREME-IP-SECURITY-MIB::esAnomalyTcpHdrSize i 9999

description: For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection ICMP
features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when an ICMP
packet received on that port if
1) the size of ICMP (IP payload) is large thant pre-configured value; or
2) it is a fragmented IP/ICMP packet (IP offset != 0)
